data.title: Convert my number
data.solution:
d,I={'hex':16,'bin':2,'dec':0},input
for i in range(int(I())):i,o,n=I().split();n=int(n,d[i]);print(eval(o+"(n)[2:].upper()")if o!="dec"else n)
data.statement:
You have [[N]] lines and for each lines, you have to convert the [[number]] from [[in]] type to [[out]] type.

Type are decimal, hexadecimal and binary.

testCases.title: Hexa one
testCases.testIn:
3
dec hex 1005
hex dec 66
hex dec F9F

testCases.title: Hexa Validator
testCases.testIn:
4
dec hex 94
dec hex 123
hex dec AAA
hex dec 33

testCases.title: Mixed one
testCases.testIn:
6
hex dec AF
dec hex 892
bin dec 1111101
dec bin 1562
bin hex 101101010101
hex bin FC

testCases.title: Mixed Validator
testCases.testIn:
6
hex dec 95
dec hex 95
bin dec 1101011111111
dec bin 816
bin hex 1111110001111
hex bin 1EE7

data.constraints:
[[in]] and [[out]] are equal to :
- "dec" for decimal
- "hex" for hexadecimal
- "bin" for binary
[[in]] and [[out]] are different on each line.

if [[out]] is "hex" then the letter(s) on the output are on uppercase.

1<[[N]]<10
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read in:word(3) out:word(3) number:word(30)
write numberConverted
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Integer [[N]] for the number of line.

<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Each line is in this format [[in]] [[out]] [[number]] (with space between them)
[[in]]: Is for the type of the [[number]]
[[out]]: Is for the type of the output number requested
[[number]]: Is the number to convert from [[in]] to [[out]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have N lines and for each lines, you have to convert the number from in type to out type.

Type are decimal, hexadecimal and binary.
Input
Line 1: Integer N for the number of line.

Next N lines: Each line is in this format in out number (with space between them)
in: Is for the type of the number
out: Is for the type of the output number requested
number: Is the number to convert from in to out
Output
N lines: With the converted number.
Constraints
in and out are equal to :
- "dec" for decimal
- "hex" for hexadecimal
- "bin" for binary
in and out are different on each line.

if out is "hex" then the letter(s) on the output are on uppercase.

1<N<10
Example
Input
2
bin dec 1010
dec bin 150
Output
10
10010110
